intro: Dianthera pleurolarynx, commonly known as the narrow-larynx bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or open areas. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Dianthera pleurolarynx is native to parts of Europe and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
